caption.p: Comparison of the concentration curve between (A) adenosine and adenine in ssDNA (5′-AATAATAATAATAA-3′) and (B) guanosine and guanine in ssDNA (5′-GGTGGTGGTGGTGG-3′). The detection sensitivity of purine bases in nucleosides and nucleotides was compared at (C) adenosine versus adenine in ssDNA at 50 μM ( p = 0.0045, n = 3, two-tailed and unpaired t-test) and (D) guanosine versus guanine in ssDNA at 50 μM ( p < 0.0001, n = 3, two-tailed and unpaired t-test). The peak oxidative current of purine bases was used to normalize the peak currents of each nucleotide in 10 bp ssDNA.
